body:
Hi @automaticgiant 

How dows your `goreleaser.yml` file looks like?

this `creating or updating release repo=git@github.redacted:automaticgiant/c1cacert ` log doesn't seem right...
closing due to lack of info and inactivity

@caarlos0 I am also facing the same issue
Cool project btw üëç 
Wish I could get it to working..

Here is my `.goreleaser.yml`
```yaml
# Build customization
builds:
  -
    main: ./cmd/main.go
    binary: reporter
    goos:
      - darwin
      - linux
    goarch:
      - amd64
before:
  hooks:
    - gometalinter ./... --exclude=/usr/local
    - go test -v -cover ./...
release:
  github:
    owner: me
    name: reporter
github_urls:
    api: https://git.redacted.com/api/v3/
    upload: https://git.redacted.com/api/v3/
    download: https://git.redacted.com/api/v3/
env_files:
  github_token : goreleaser
```

# Output

```
$ goreleaser --rm-dist --release-notes=Changelog.md --skip-validate --debug
   ‚Ä¢ RELEASING TO GITHUB
      ‚Ä¢ creating or updating release repo=me/reporter tag=v0.1.0
      ‚Ä¢ release updated           url=https://git.redacted.com/me/reporter/releases/tag/v0.1.0
      ‚Ä¢ uploading to release      file=dist/reporter_0.1.0_darwin_amd64.tar.gz name=reporter_0.1.0_darwin_amd64.tar.gz
      ‚Ä¢ uploading to release      file=dist/reporter_0.1.0_checksums.txt name=reporter_0.1.0_checksums.txt
      ‚Ä¢ uploading to release      file=dist/reporter_0.1.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz name=reporter_0.1.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz
   ‚®Ø release failed after 6.85s error=POST https://git.redacted.com/api/v3/repos/me/reporter/releases/5382/assets?name=reporter_0.1.0_checksums.txt: 404 Not Found []
```

## Version
```
$ goreleaser -v
0.73.1, commit c3988a30fc96b211432d289e0bf7c6fb3b24885b, built at 2018-05-04T04:06:03Z
```

hi @mohanraj-r, thanks for the infos!

Can you run without `--skip-validate` and paste the logs here?

@caarlos0 Here is the output without `--skip-validate`

```
$ goreleaser --rm-dist --release-notes=Changelog.md  --debug
....
 ‚Ä¢ WRITING EFFECTIVE CONFIG FILE
      ‚Ä¢ writing                   config=dist/config.yaml
   ‚Ä¢ GENERATING CHANGELOG
      ‚Ä¢ skipped                   reason=release notes already provided via --release-notes
   ‚Ä¢ LOADING ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES
   ‚Ä¢ BUILDING BINARIES
      ‚Ä¢ building                  build={[darwin linux] [amd64] [6] [darwin_amd64 linux_amd64] [] ./cmd/main.go -s -w -X main.version={{.Version}} -X main.comm
it={{.Commit}} -X main.date={{.Date}}  reporter { } [] go  }
      ‚Ä¢ building                  binary=dist/darwin_amd64/reporter
      ‚Ä¢ building                  binary=dist/linux_amd64/reporter
      ‚Ä¢ running                   cmd=[go build -ldflags=-s -w -X main.version=0.1.0 -X main.commit=dd90921feb75945b4463f905f313667bd242e2fc -X main.date=2018-
05-08T18:43:29Z -o dist/darwin_amd64/reporter ./cmd/main.go] env=[GOOS=darwin GOARCH=amd64 GOARM=]
      ‚Ä¢ running                   cmd=[go build -ldflags=-s -w -X main.version=0.1.0 -X main.commit=dd90921feb75945b4463f905f313667bd242e2fc -X main.date=2018-
05-08T18:43:29Z -o dist/linux_amd64/reporter ./cmd/main.go] env=[GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 GOARM=]
      ‚Ä¢ added new artifact        name=reporter path=dist/linux_amd64/reporter type=Binary
      ‚Ä¢ added new artifact        name=reporter path=dist/darwin_amd64/reporter type=Binary
   ‚Ä¢ CREATING ARCHIVES
      ‚Ä¢ creating                  archive=dist/reporter_0.1.0_darwin_amd64.tar.gz
      ‚Ä¢ creating                  archive=dist/reporter_0.1.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz
      ‚Ä¢ adding Changelog.md
      ‚Ä¢ adding Changelog.md
      ‚Ä¢ adding README.md
      ‚Ä¢ adding README.md
      ‚Ä¢ adding reporter
      ‚Ä¢ adding reporter
      ‚Ä¢ added new artifact        name=reporter_0.1.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz path=dist/reporter_0.1.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz type=UploadableArchive
      ‚Ä¢ added new artifact        name=reporter_0.1.0_darwin_amd64.tar.gz path=dist/reporter_0.1.0_darwin_amd64.tar.gz type=UploadableArchive
   ‚Ä¢ CREATING LINUX PACKAGES WITH NFPM
      ‚Ä¢ skipped                   reason=no output formats configured
   ‚Ä¢ CREATING LINUX PACKAGES WITH SNAPCRAFT
      ‚Ä¢ skipped                   reason=no summary nor description were provided
   ‚Ä¢ CALCULATING CHECKSUMS
      ‚Ä¢ added new artifact        name=reporter_0.1.0_checksums.txt path=dist/reporter_0.1.0_checksums.txt type=Checksum
      ‚Ä¢ checksumming              file=reporter_0.1.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz
	  ‚Ä¢ checksumming              file=reporter_0.1.0_darwin_amd64.tar.gz
   ‚Ä¢ SIGNING ARTIFACTS
      ‚Ä¢ skipped                   reason=artifact signing disabled
   ‚Ä¢ CREATING DOCKER IMAGES
      ‚Ä¢ skipped                   reason=docker section is not configured
   ‚Ä¢ RELEASING TO ARTIFACTORY
      ‚Ä¢ skipped                   reason=artifactory section is not configured
   ‚Ä¢ RELEASING TO GITHUB
      ‚Ä¢ creating or updating release repo=me/reporter tag=v0.1.0
      ‚Ä¢ release updated           url=https://git.redacted.com/me/reporter/releases/tag/v0.1.0
      ‚Ä¢ uploading to release      file=dist/reporter_0.1.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz name=reporter_0.1.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz
      ‚Ä¢ uploading to release      file=dist/reporter_0.1.0_darwin_amd64.tar.gz name=reporter_0.1.0_darwin_amd64.tar.gz
      ‚Ä¢ uploading to release      file=dist/reporter_0.1.0_checksums.txt name=reporter_0.1.0_checksums.txt
   ‚®Ø release failed after 8.13s error=POST https://git.redacted.com/api/v3/repos/me/reporter/releases/5397/assets?name=reporter_0.1.0
_checksums.txt: 404 Not Found []
```

Made sure to clear out the existing releases/tags in github before triggering this - but that didn't seem to make a difference. The release does get created in github with specified release notes and the source code archives. Its the contents of the `dist` which don't get uploaded.

yeah, I think your upload URL is wrong on settings, it usually is something like `uploads.github.foo.bar` ```yaml upload: https://git.redacted.com/api/v3/ ``` https://goreleaser.com/environment/#github-enterprise
Environment ¬∑ GoReleaser
please let me know if it works, if so, I'll update the docs üòÑ

Thanks @caarlos0 . Finally got it working ! The URLs that worked for me were 
```
    api: https://git.company.com/api/v3/
    upload: https://git.company.com/api/uploads/
    download: https://git.company.com/
```
Tried without `v3` in `api` and with `v3` in `upload` - didn't work. Guess that is how it is configured here. 
Would be nice if github had an easy way of discovering these urls. 

Btw what is the download url used for ?
Would be nice to have a `replace/update` option for release to update/overwrite existing releases - instead of having to manually delete them in github ui.

> Btw what is the download url used for ?

for homebrew formulas, for instance, you can it empty if you don't use brew...

> Would be nice to have a replace/update option for release to update/overwrite existing releases - instead of having to manually delete them in github ui.

as long the tag is the same, if you run goreleaser again it will edit the pre-existing release.

Thanks for the clarifications @caarlos0 

> as long the tag is the same, if you run goreleaser again it will edit the pre-existing release.

Tried that - it fails with the error msg `ReleaseAsset .. already_exists`

```
 ‚®Ø release failed after 7.09s error=POST https://git.company.com/api/uploads/repos/me/reporter/releases/5400/assets?name=reporter_0.1.0_checksums.txt: 422 Validation Failed [{Resource:ReleaseAsset Field:name Code:already_exists Message:}]
```
